documents.title: record year for air ambulance
text: derbyshire , leicestershire and rutland air ambulance said 2016 was its busiest ever year with 1,926 missions carried out .
the total was boosted by the launch in may of its night car service , which replaces the helicopter at night and when weather conditions stop it taking flight during the day .

documents.title: mousinho : 'do n't obsess over table '
text: burton albion kept themselves three points clear of the relegation zone with a 2-1 win over wolves on saturday but midfielder john mousinho says it 's important the players do n't become too preoccupied with their league position .
he said : `` if you just focus on your own performance and games , you 're probably better off thinking you can just nick a point here or three points there .
`` it 's hard not to look at the table but i do n't think we should plan too far ahead in terms of where we 're going to points up . ''
author: BBC Derby Sport

documents.title: widow 's 'goosebumps ' at meeting kidney recipient
text: carol laight said meeting the man who received her late husband 's kidney two years ago made her feel emotional .
she said : `` it gives me goosebumps because simon 's doing the sort of things john always dreamed of doing but never got round to .
`` it 's lovely - and john would have been well chuffed it 's a local lad . ''
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man determined to look after new kidney
text: since receiving john laight 's kidney , simon elmore has won a collection of medals at the transplant games and recently completed a 100-mile walk across derbyshire and nottinghamshire to encourage more people to join the organ donor register .
he said : `` my only thought is to look after it , do well and stay fit because it 's not fair to my organ donor to let him down . ''
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'your husband changed my life '
text: a belper man whose life was transformed by a kidney transplant two years ago has had an emotional meeting with his donor 's family .
simon elmore had spent seven years on dialysis due to kidney failure before receiving the organ following the death of john laight , from draycott .
doctors had told mr laight 's widow carol her husband 's kidney could end up anywhere in the world - instead it ended up going to someone just 15 miles down the road .
mr elmore told the bbc he 'd been struggling to make it up the stairs prior to the transplant but within days of the operation was fit enough to walk for miles .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live
